Event.name: Motion_noise
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frame pertains to noise verbs used to characterize motion. Motion_noise verbs take largely the same <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen> expressions as other types of Motion verbs.
<ex><fex name="Thm">The reception doors</fex> <t>banged</t> <fex name="Result">open</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Thm">Guillemots and razor bills</fex> <t>whirred</t> <fex name="Spd">rapidly</fex> <fex name="Goal">out to sea</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Thm">The limousine</fex> <t>purred</t> <fex name="Path">forwards</fex> <fex name="Goal">into the traffic</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Thm">Loose guns</fex> <t>rumbled</t> <fex name="Area">all over the ship's deck</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Thm">The train</fex> <t>clanged</t> along <fex name="Dist">for over a thousand miles</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> describes the reason for the motion. <ex>The glasses <t>clinked</t> across the table <fex name="Cause">during the tornado</fex>.</ex></def-root >

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location. In sentences containing a <fen>Cause</fen>, the <fen>Theme</fen> is typically the NP Object. In other sentences, the <fen>Theme</fen> is normally the External Argument.
<ex><fex name="Theme">Pat</fex> <t>crunched</t> over the fresh snow.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of Motion.
<ex>The train <t>rumbled</t> <fex name="Source">out of the station</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex>The truck <t>roared</t> <fex name="Path">through the tunnel</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up as a result of the Motion.
<ex>The plates <t>clattered</t> <fex name="Goal">to the floor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Area
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the general <fen>Area</fen> in which motion takes place, used particularly if the motion is understood as following a complex or non-linear path.
<ex>The fly <t>buzzed</t> <fex name="Area">about the room</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Distance
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Distance</fen> is any expression which characterizes the extent of Motion. This frame element occurs very infrequently with Motion_noise verbs.
<ex>The car <t>wheezed</t> <fex name="Dist">the two miles</fex> into town.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which the motion occurs.
<ex>My Saab <t>purrs</t> along easily <fex name="Speed">at 80 miles an hour</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Depictive</fen> indicates the state of the <fen>Theme</fen> during Motion.
<ex>The car <t>chugged</t> across the ruts, <fex name="Dep">unstoppable</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the way in which the Motion takes place.
<ex>The drone <t>buzzed</t> <fex name="Manr">curiously</fex> across the room and vanished behind the table.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Theme</fen> moves in the specified way.
<ex>The autochopper <t>whirred</t> along<fex name="Mns"> by supplementing its onboard power with solar generators</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> is the ultimate effect of the Motion.
<ex>The door of the empty box <t>creaked</t> <fex name="Result">open</fex> in the wind.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the Motion occurs.
<ex>Suddenly , the pole <t>thumped</t> <fex name="Degr">really hard</fex> into an unseen object.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location of a more specific motion (which has <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, <fen>Goal</fen>, or <fen>Area</fen>).</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The period of time for which the <fen>Theme</fen> moves under accompaniment of noise.
<ex>From there they <t>roared</t> northward <fex name="Duration">for about 10 minutes</fex> before turning up the beach approach onto A1.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the motion event takes place. <ex>The train <t>screeched</t> into the station <fex name="Time">at half past seven</fex></ex></def-root >

lexUnit.name: bang.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a sharp noise or thump

lexUnit.name: buzz.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a low humming noise similar to that of a bee.

lexUnit.name: chug.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a dull explosive sound as if by a laboring engine

lexUnit.name: clack.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a short striking noise.

lexUnit.name: clang.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a loud resounding metallic noise.

lexUnit.name: clank.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making an abrupt metallic noise.

lexUnit.name: clatter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a rattling noise.

lexUnit.name: click.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a slight sharp sound.

lexUnit.name: clink.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a slight metallic noise.

lexUnit.name: clump.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a dull heavy noise.

lexUnit.name: clunk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: to move making a thumping noise.

lexUnit.name: crackle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making soft sharp repeating sounds.

lexUnit.name: crash.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move with a smashing noise

lexUnit.name: creak.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a harsh, high-pitched noise

lexUnit.name: crunch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a grinding sound

lexUnit.name: fizz.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a hissing or crackling sound.

lexUnit.name: gurgle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a hollow bubbling sound.

lexUnit.name: howl.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a wailing, crying sound

lexUnit.name: patter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: run making a light tapping sound.

lexUnit.name: ping.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making an abrupt high-pitched ringing sound.

lexUnit.name: purr.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a low, continuous vibrating sound.

lexUnit.name: putter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a rapid intermittent sound, as of a small engine.

lexUnit.name: roar.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move with great noise or commotion

lexUnit.name: rumble.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a continuous, deep, resonant sound.

lexUnit.name: rustle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a muffled crackling sound, like that of the movement of dry leaves or paper.

lexUnit.name: screech.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a loud, harsh, piercing sound.

lexUnit.name: splash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: strike or move around in water, causing it to fly about.

lexUnit.name: splutter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making short, explosive spitting or choking sounds.

lexUnit.name: squelch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move with such a sound.

lexUnit.name: swish.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move with a hissing or rushing sound.

lexUnit.name: thud.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a dull, leaden sound.

lexUnit.name: thump.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a forceful, heavy sound.

lexUnit.name: thunder.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making a loud rumbling or crashing sound

lexUnit.name: wheeze.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move making an irregular rattling or spluttering sound

lexUnit.name: whine.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move so as to make a continuous high-pitched sound

lexUnit.name: whir.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move with a buzzing sound or an extended soft swish

lexUnit.name: zing.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move swiftly.

lexUnit.name: hiss.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a sibilant sound as of the letter s
